condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The Government has improved capacity to provide equitable and quality HIV/AIDS prevention, treatment, care and support services for women and children by 2018.

description.narrative: HIV positivity rate of the exposed children aged 0-14 decreased to 10 percent (from 15.3 percent in 2018) with enhanced integrated mentoring and supportive supervision to improve capacity of 370 service providers in 207 facilities on the Prevention of Mother to Child Transmission (PMTCT), Early Infant Diagnosis and Paediatric Anti-retroviral Therapy. About 6,800 children and adolescents were tested through the community-based index case family testing, and those tested positive were referred to health facilities for confirmation and enrolment to appropriate and equitable care and support, while additional 300 most vulnerable children benefited from psychological counselling, recreational activities, and educational tour. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2019
